    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/mideast/russian-hand-seen-behind-increased-bombing-syrian-hospitals-n847961?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Six miles can be the difference between life and death for Syria's wounded</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 09:55:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/mideast/russian-hand-seen-behind-increased-bombing-syrian-hospitals-n847961?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ziad Jaber and F. Brinley Bruton  and Elena Holodny and Alice Tidey and Reuters and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>Doctors with the Syrian American Medical Society report a sharp rise in the number of hospital attacks since the start of the year.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328516/180214-syria-ghouta-airstrike-injured-njs-1002a_5ff35788ff126e623f1f7d4cfaab3ee0.jpg" medium="image" height="1697" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Amer Almohibany</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Syrian rescuers evacuate a person injured following airstrikes<media:description type="plain">Rescuers assist a victim following airstrikes on the besieged rebel-held enclave of Kafr Batna, Syria,  on Feb. 6.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328521/180214-syria-ghouta-hospital-njs-1010a_21916582a763aef0d5781a6a6d96204f.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Mohammed Badra</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Patients await treatment<media:description type="plain">Patients await treatment at a hospital in Eastern Ghouta, Syria.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/airplane-mode/iran-plane-crash-passenger-aircraft-carrying-66-people-goes-down-n849136?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Plane crashes in southern Iran, killing all 66 on board</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 13:06:08 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/airplane-mode/iran-plane-crash-passenger-aircraft-carrying-66-people-goes-down-n849136?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ali Arouzi and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The ATR-72, a twin-engine turboprop used for short-distance regional flying, went down some 390 miles south of the capital, Tehran.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332981/semiron_040c6bec684dd293c968ba2d6e3a6838.jpg" medium="image" height="640" width="1047">
        <media:credit>Google Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Location of Semirom<media:description type="plain">Location of Semirom, Iran.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-punk-rockers-say-swedish-exile-price-opposing-putin-n847896?cid=public-rss_20180218&cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Punk rockers pay the price for criticizing Putin</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:07:45 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-punk-rockers-say-swedish-exile-price-opposing-putin-n847896?cid=public-rss_20180218&cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Alexander Smith and Vladimir Banic and Alan Kaytukov</dc:creator>
      <description>With Vladimir Putin expected to secure a fourth term next month, Pussy Riot members Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan are claiming asylum in Sweden.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328081/180212-pussy-riot-exile102_be44ba3028d5fb766378a28fd19801f4.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Pussy Riot activists Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan have fled Russia for Sweden.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328406/180214-pussy-riot-mc-1408_10a3946a68355257c728586eb2632b1c.JPG" medium="image" height="2892" width="4206">
        <media:credit>Sergey Ponomarev</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot<media:description type="plain">Members of Pussy Riot chant a "punk prayer" that criticized Vladimir Putin at the Christ the Saviour Cathedral in Moscow, Russia, in 2012.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328091/180212-pussy-riot-exile104_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">The apartment block where Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan live in Sweden.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328111/180212-pussy-riot-exile108_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1949" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky looks in his bathroom mirror.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328456/180214-pussy-riot-0950_66cc55b7cfd888845a651df9d1d17184.jpg" medium="image" height="2436" width="3496">
        <media:credit>ANDREY SMIRNOV</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Yekaterina Samutsevich, Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova<media:description type="plain">Pussy Riot members Yekaterina Samutsevich (left), Maria Alyokhina (center) and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova (right) during a court hearing in Moscow on Aug. 17, 2012.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328116/180212-pussy-riot-exile109_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1896" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan with their son, Tigran.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328106/180212-pussy-riot-exile107_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan have been in Sweden for almost a year.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/these-chinese-military-innovations-threaten-u-s-superiority-experts-say-n848596?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>With railguns and robots, China's military threatens U.S. dominance</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 09:55:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/these-chinese-military-innovations-threaten-u-s-superiority-experts-say-n848596?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Eric Baculinao</dc:creator>
      <description>Over the past year, China has rolled out an array of high-tech weapons that some experts say could threaten the military superiority of the United States.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331441/180216-china-missile-mn-1210_57e43d34bc01f134a999819bf87535f1.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Damir Sagolj</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Military vehicles carrying DF-21D ballistic missiles roll through Tiananmen Square in 2015.<media:description type="plain">Military vehicles carrying DF-21D ballistic missiles roll through Tiananmen Square in 2015.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331371/180216-chengdu-j-20-mn-1100_4ee61e5a41c99f009196ac67e022536c.jpg" medium="image" height="1827" width="2500">
        <media:credit>CCP/ColorChinaPhoto</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: China's J-20 stealth fighter aircraft<media:description type="plain">The J-20 is China's first homemade stealth jet.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331346/180216-china-aircraft-carrier-mn-1040_b0640e8c77f02e012ffeca2a1054a657.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Bei piao</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">China launches first domestically built aircraft carrier<media:description type="plain">China's first domestically-built aircraft carrier, the Type 001A, takes water at Dalian Port in northeast China's Liaoning province in April 2017.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/iran-israel-battle-openly-race-define-rules-game-n847946?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Iran, Israel clash in race to define 'new rules of the game'</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 09:59:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/iran-israel-battle-openly-race-define-rules-game-n847946?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Kennett Werner and Paul Goldman</dc:creator>
      <description>The shift from covert attacks to open fighting between Iran and Israel illustrates that Tehran feels emboldened enough to confront and provoke its rival.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328326/180214-f16-syria-mc-1303_b7a64ad71fc846c979198aa1b412e809.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jack Guez</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Israeli F-16<media:description type="plain">An Israeli F-16 that crashed after coming under fire from Syrian air defenses on Saturday.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329911/map_fab27bebb972645a870b9eb93050e05f.jpg" medium="image" height="300" width="696">
        <media:credit>Bing Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: A map showing Israel, Syria, Iran and Lebanon<media:description type="plain">A map showing countries including Israel, Iran, Syria and Lebanon.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-punk-rockers-say-swedish-exile-price-opposing-putin-n847896?cid=public-rss_20180218&cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Punk rockers pay the price for criticizing Putin</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:07:45 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russian-punk-rockers-say-swedish-exile-price-opposing-putin-n847896?cid=public-rss_20180218&cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Alexander Smith and Vladimir Banic and Alan Kaytukov</dc:creator>
      <description>With Vladimir Putin expected to secure a fourth term next month, Pussy Riot members Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan are claiming asylum in Sweden.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328081/180212-pussy-riot-exile102_be44ba3028d5fb766378a28fd19801f4.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Pussy Riot activists Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan have fled Russia for Sweden.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328406/180214-pussy-riot-mc-1408_10a3946a68355257c728586eb2632b1c.JPG" medium="image" height="2892" width="4206">
        <media:credit>Sergey Ponomarev</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot<media:description type="plain">Members of Pussy Riot chant a "punk prayer" that criticized Vladimir Putin at the Christ the Saviour Cathedral in Moscow, Russia, in 2012.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328091/180212-pussy-riot-exile104_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">The apartment block where Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan live in Sweden.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328111/180212-pussy-riot-exile108_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1949" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky looks in his bathroom mirror.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328456/180214-pussy-riot-0950_66cc55b7cfd888845a651df9d1d17184.jpg" medium="image" height="2436" width="3496">
        <media:credit>ANDREY SMIRNOV</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Yekaterina Samutsevich, Maria Alyokhina and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova<media:description type="plain">Pussy Riot members Yekaterina Samutsevich (left), Maria Alyokhina (center) and Nadezhda Tolokonnikova (right) during a court hearing in Moscow on Aug. 17, 2012.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328116/180212-pussy-riot-exile109_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1896" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan with their son, Tigran.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328106/180212-pussy-riot-exile107_ef56f406b58efe4ca1b6248c5cf7a4fe.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Vladimir Banic</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pussy Riot Exile<media:description type="plain">Alexey Knedlyakovsky and Lusine Djanyan have been in Sweden for almost a year.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/meghan-markle-spreads-her-wings-ways-reminiscent-diana-n847891?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Meghan Markle quietly spreads her wings in ways reminiscent of Diana</title>
      <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 12:18:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/meghan-markle-spreads-her-wings-ways-reminiscent-diana-n847891?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Rachel Elbaum  and Reuters</dc:creator>
      <description>Prince Harry's wife-to-be Meghan Markle has an unprecedented opportunity to shine a light on issues affecting minorities, analysts say.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328121/180214-meghan-hug-mc-922_06d74d340ee785405650121b699a943d.JPG" medium="image" height="2007" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Brian Anderson</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle visit to Edinburgh<media:description type="plain">Meghan Markle hugs Alice Thompson, the co-founder of a cafe that employs and distributes food to the homeless, during a visit to Edinburgh, Scotland, on Tuesday.  </media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328126/180214-grenfell-tower-mc-924_06d74d340ee785405650121b699a943d.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Dan Kitwood</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Grenfell Tower<media:description type="plain">The remains of London's Grenfell Tower.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328071/180214-al-manaar-center-mc-8142_62eed38e8290cd6b013feaa215888d3c.JPG" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Jack Taylor</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Al-Manaar Muslim Cultural Center<media:description type="plain">Volunteers sort through donations for victims at the Al-Manaar Muslim Cultural Centre in the aftermath of the Grenfell Tower fire. </media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-strikes-gaza-after-bomb-wounds-soldiers-two-palestinians-dead-n849146?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Israel strikes Gaza after soldiers wounded; 2 Palestinian teens killed</title>
      <pubDate>Sun, 18 Feb 2018 12:23:32 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/israel-strikes-gaza-after-bomb-wounds-soldiers-two-palestinians-dead-n849146?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Paul Goldman and Lawahez Jabari and Alice Tidey and Associated Press and Reuters</dc:creator>
      <description>Israel launched attacks on 18 targets belonging to the Hamas militant group after four soldiers were wounded Saturday when a bomb detonated on the border with Gaza.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332996/gaza_4c3be4d5e2878d5257ffb99251fad67b.jpg" medium="image" height="598" width="1091">
        <media:credit>Google Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Map shows location of the Gaza Strip<media:description type="plain">Map shows location of the Gaza Strip.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/4-4-magnitude-earthquake-rattles-south-wales-n849036?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Wales hit by strongest quake in 100 years</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 17:57:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/4-4-magnitude-earthquake-rattles-south-wales-n849036?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Chelsea Bailey</dc:creator>
      <description>It was the strongest recorded earthquake in the area for more than 100 years, according to the British Geological Survey.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332596/180217-brynmill-swansea-1245p-rs_889a6f0c763329af5c47e278d3a0c399.jpg" medium="image" height="1875" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Panoramio</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: A street in Brynmill, Swansea, UK.<media:description type="plain">A street in Brynmill, Swansea, UK.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/sacred-tibetan-monastery-catches-fire-no-reports-casualties-n849026?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Sacred Tibetan monastery catches fire</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 16:35:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/sacred-tibetan-monastery-catches-fire-no-reports-casualties-n849026?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>The Jokhang Monastery in Lhasa, one of the most sacred locations in Tibetan Buddhism, caught fire on Saturday but there were no reports of any casualties.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332566/180217-jokhang-monastery-1107a-rs_d3d9967a2116c703ad4e1c44253823e5.jpg" medium="image" height="1286" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Yin nan</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: The Jokhang Temple in Lhasa, southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region.<media:description type="plain">The Jokhang Temple in Lhasa, southwest China's Tibet Autonomous Region.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-s-lavrov-calls-fbi-indictments-just-blabber-n849001?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>'Just blabber': Russia's Lavrov dismisses FBI indictments</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 16:16:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-s-lavrov-calls-fbi-indictments-just-blabber-n849001?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Saphora Smith and Alex Holmes and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>"Until we see the facts, everything else is just blabber," Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov told participants at the annual Munich Security Conference.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332561/180217-lavrov-munich-1052a-rs_3fe1ba5586b3d08cc80f412929e4b2e2.JPG" medium="image" height="1940" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Ronald Wittek</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Sergey Lavrov<media:description type="plain">Russia's Sergey Lavrov at the Munich Security Conference on Saturday</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbqehf1bKvQ&feature=youtu.be</guid>
      <title>How Russia sent an Idaho town into a fake news tailspin</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:51:35 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wbqehf1bKvQ&feature=youtu.be</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>Russian operatives have targeted Twin Falls, Idaho, with a fake anti-immigration campaign launched on Facebook.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2331841/180216-left-field-idaho-town-fake-new-ew-420p_4f8bca68d54d9d5627ac22d11929bba8.jpg" medium="image" height="1224" width="2176">
        <media:credit>NBC Left Field</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Russian operatives have targeted Twin Falls, Idaho<media:description type="plain">Russian operatives have targeted Twin Falls, Idaho with a fake anti-immigration campaign launched on Facebook. NBC Left Field investigates.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/winter-olympics-2018/u-s-born-ice-dancers-alex-gamelin-yura-min-fulfill-n847851?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>How U.S.-born ice dancers ended up competing for South Korea</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 14:47:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/storyline/winter-olympics-2018/u-s-born-ice-dancers-alex-gamelin-yura-min-fulfill-n847851?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Rima Abdelkader and Brock Stoneham</dc:creator>
      <description>Gamelin and Min made their Olympic debut in PyeongChang grabbing headlines, but for reasons they never expected — a wardrobe malfunction.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329636/180214-yura-min-alex-gamelin-ac-1104p_c45eaa47bc8b9056e04cbe594094a507.jpg" medium="image" height="1615" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Tatyana Zenkovich</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Figure Skating - PyeongChang 2018 Olympic Games<media:description type="plain">Yura Min has a clasp in her costume come undone as she and Alex Gamelin, representing South Korea, compete during the ice dance short dance on Feb. 11, 2018.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2328026/180213_skaters-3-ac-1147p_accfa777864473eeb994e83f32f66d99.jpg" medium="image" height="1406" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Brock Stoneham</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Skaters<media:description type="plain">Yura Min and Alex Gamelin skate together during their practice at the Novi Ice Arena on Jan. 31, 2018 in Michigan.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/pope-revives-lapsed-sex-abuse-commission-after-coming-under-fire-n848991?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Pope revives lapsed sex abuse commission after coming under fire</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 13:25:19 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/pope-revives-lapsed-sex-abuse-commission-after-coming-under-fire-n848991?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The commission's mission was to advise the Francis on best practices to protect children, but it faced strong in-house resistance to some of its core proposals.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2017_41/2183586/171009-pope-francis-ac-709p_b326a5d4baec1cfe0c6183e733611ed7.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Andreas Solaro</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pope Francis<media:description type="plain">Pope Francis</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/trio-suicide-bombers-kill-18-crowded-market-nigeria-n848961?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Trio of suicide bombers killd 18 at crowded market in Nigeria</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 09:21:42 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/trio-suicide-bombers-kill-18-crowded-market-nigeria-n848961?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The bombers, all believed to be female, left another 22 people wounded at a fish market Konduga, just outside the state capital, Maiduguri.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/mexico/two-killed-mexico-helicopter-crash-interior-minister-survives-n848891?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Two killed in Mexico helicopter crash, interior minister survives</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 06:04:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/mexico/two-killed-mexico-helicopter-crash-interior-minister-survives-n848891?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>A military helicopter carrying Mexico's interior minister and the governor of the southern state of Oaxaca crashed on Friday, killing two people on the ground.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/powerful-earthquake-slams-south-central-mexico-n848841?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Powerful earthquake slams south, central Mexico</title>
      <pubDate>Sat, 17 Feb 2018 02:27:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/powerful-earthquake-slams-south-central-mexico-n848841?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>A powerful earthquake has shaken south and central Mexico, causing people to flee buildings and office towers in the country's capital, and setting off quake alert systems. Crowds of people gathered on central Reforma Avenue as the ground shook.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332116/180216-mexico-earthquake-ac-724p_15384788ebb58f00340a45d0eb63cc19.jpg" medium="image" height="1876" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Claudia Daut</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: People stand on the street after an earthquake shook buildings in Mexico City<media:description type="plain">People stand on the street after an earthquake shook buildings February 16, 2018 in Mexico City.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2332116/180216-mexico-earthquake-ac-724p_15384788ebb58f00340a45d0eb63cc19.jpg" medium="image" height="1876" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Claudia Daut</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: People stand on the street after an earthquake shook buildings in Mexico City<media:description type="plain">People stand on the street after an earthquake shook buildings February 16, 2018 in Mexico City.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/first-read/russia-timeline-key-players-meetings-investigation-details-n840786?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>

      <dc:creator>NBC News</dc:creator>
      <description>As special counsel Mueller continues his inquiries into Russia collusion in the 2016 election, new information continues to be added to the timeline of facts.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_04/2305776/180125-russia-timeline-inline-se-527p_76b7ea52e37da9eaf59e672c0fd09642.jpg" medium="image" height="350" width="2400">
        <media:credit>EPA, AP, Reuters, AFP - Getty Images</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Vladimir Putin, Jeff Sessions, Donald Trump, Paul Manafort, Donald Trump Jr., James Comey<media:description type="plain"></media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>

    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/cuban-embassy-staff-had-concussion-injuries-doctors-say-n848291?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Cuba embassy staff had concussion-like injury</title>
      <pubDate>Fri, 16 Feb 2018 12:15:14 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/cuban-embassy-staff-had-concussion-injuries-doctors-say-n848291?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Maggie Fox</dc:creator>
      <description>Medical exams raise more questions than answers</description>
      <media:content url="http://media1.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2268626/171212-us-embassy-cuba_935e0f137a65f05a81fa8b257043a19c.jpg" medium="image" height="2334" width="3500">
        <media:credit>ALEXANDRE MENEGHINI</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: People talk to security officials at the U.S. Embassy in Havana<media:description type="plain">People talk to security officials at the U.S. Embassy in Havana, Cuba, December 12, 2017.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/social-media/russian-trolls-flood-twitter-after-parkland-shooting-n848471?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Russian trolls flood Twitter after shooting</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 22:20:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/tech/social-media/russian-trolls-flood-twitter-after-parkland-shooting-n848471?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Ben Popken and Jo Ling Kent</dc:creator>
      <description>Covert Russian propaganda flooded Twitter after the Parkland shooting to stoke America's raw divides.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329301/180214-school-shooting-parkland-florida-se-619p_a99682ca1111ce61d7ca5043a52f1c50.jpg" medium="image" height="1855" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Joe Raedle</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Students are brought out of the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School<media:description type="plain">Students are brought out of the Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School after a shooting at the school in Parkland, Florida on Feb. 14, 2018 .</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330406/2tweets_330f816162a4f535aa93e839d5fd18d0.jpg" medium="image" height="672" width="579">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"><media:description type="plain">Screenshots of tweets controlled by unknown persons using the same hashtags as those flagged by the Hamilton 68 dashboard following the Parkland shooting.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2330411/othertweets_d3444052304051099b389af441d8d67a.jpg" medium="image" height="765" width="581">
        <media:credit></media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain"><media:description type="plain">Twitter accounts who have not been identified as Russian trolls but used the same hashtags amplified by the Kremlin-linked influence networks weighed in on every side of the ideological spectrum in the wake of the Parkland shooting.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/military/will-trump-release-prisoner-guantanamo-n848341?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Trump may release a prisoner from Guantanamo</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 18:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/military/will-trump-release-prisoner-guantanamo-n848341?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Courtney Kube</dc:creator>
      <description>Ahmed Mohammed Ahmed Haza al-Darbi, a Saudi citizen held since 2002, made a plea deal in 2014 that said he would be released to Saudi Arabia.</description>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-says-u-s-airstrike-killed-5-its-civilians-syria-n848261?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>American strike in Syria killed 5 Russians, Moscow says</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 15:18:56 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/russia-says-u-s-airstrike-killed-5-its-civilians-syria-n848261?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>The incident marks the first time Russians and Americans have become directly engaged in combat in Syria.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_06/2321006/syria_3e28a8ba7a7cf43bc82bad37af4e2878.jpg" medium="image" height="793" width="1105">
        <media:credit>Google Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Map shows location of Deir el-Zour<media:description type="plain">A map showing the location of Deir el-Zour in eastern Syria.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/south-africa-s-next-leader-cyril-ramaphosa-faces-plenty-challenges-n845431?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Mandela protégé takes charge after South Africa's scandal-tainted leader quits</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 14:51:49 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/south-africa-s-next-leader-cyril-ramaphosa-faces-plenty-challenges-n845431?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Rachel Elbaum  and Alastair Jamieson and Associated Press</dc:creator>
      <description>Cyril Ramaphosa grew up in Soweto, Johannesburg's notoriously impoverished segregated township. But his toughest years may lie ahead.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_06/2318086/180206-mandela-ramaphosa-mc-1213_a79e4c9d135befbe0473ffc0db6af081.JPG" medium="image" height="1640" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Walter Dhladhla</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Mandela and Ramaphosa<media:description type="plain">Nelson Mandela and Cyril Ramaphosa in 1994.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329726/180215-cyril_-0203_6b850a3ced0992ce786bbdaf6a1f157d.jpg" medium="image" height="2832" width="4256">
        <media:credit>RODGER BOSCH</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Cyril Ramaphosa<media:description type="plain">Cyril Ramaphosa was the ANC's chief negotiator with South Africa's apartheid rulers during the talks that led to the end of white rule, and is seen as a conciliatory figure who could help heal divisions that widened under Zuma.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2329731/180215-180214-jacob-zuma-0205_4c12f181f34ab2727f08ff375828142c.jpg" medium="image" height="1709" width="2431">
        <media:credit>SIPHIWE SIBEKO</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Jacob Zuma<media:description type="plain">Jacob Zuma resigned as South Africa's president on Wednesday.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_06/2320996/map_6f3ad116e26ca7360c62d6a524d07b86.jpg" medium="image" height="513" width="747">
        <media:credit>Bing Maps</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Map showing Soweto<media:description type="plain">A map showing the location of Soweto.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/more-10-000-afghan-civilians-killed-or-wounded-2017-u-n848241?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>10,000 civilians were killed or wounded in Afghanistan last year</title>
      <pubDate>Thu, 15 Feb 2018 11:32:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/world/more-10-000-afghan-civilians-killed-or-wounded-2017-u-n848241?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator />
      <description>President Donald Trump stepped up airstrikes in Afghanistan, and militants responded. More than 10,000 civilians were killed or wounded in 2017, the U.N. says.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media3.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2019561/ss-170531-kabul-blast-mn-06_d8f31e7ae78360fdb822a2272a46a4f8.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Omar Sabhani</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: An Afghan man reacts at the site of a blast in Kabul, Afghanistan<media:description type="plain">An Afghan man reacts at the site of a massive blast in Kabul's diplomatic quarter on May 31, 2017.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
    <item>
      <guid isPermaLink="false">https://www.nbcnews.com/news/asian-america/chloe-kim-s-olympics-triumph-realizes-american-dream-immigrant-family-n847541?cid=public-rss_20180218</guid>
      <title>Chloe Kim's beaming dad is one of the breakout stars of the Olympics</title>
      <pubDate>Wed, 14 Feb 2018 18:34:00 GMT</pubDate>
      <link>https://www.nbcnews.com/news/asian-america/chloe-kim-s-olympics-triumph-realizes-american-dream-immigrant-family-n847541?cid=public-rss_20180218</link>
      <dc:creator>Daniel Arkin and Reuters</dc:creator>
      <description>Jong Jin Kim, who moved to the United States from South Korea in 1982, won over spectators around the world with his charming signs and irrepressible pride.</description>
      <media:content url="http://media2.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2327191/180213-chloe-kim-gold-main-art_8a69e4fc18ac08f402b4be287f6282b7.jpg" medium="image" height="1667" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Kirill Kudryavtsev</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Chloe Kim hold her gold medal<media:description type="plain">Chloe Kim poses on the podium with her gold medal for halfpipe on Tuesday.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
      <media:content url="http://media4.s-nbcnews.com/i/newscms/2018_07/2326796/180213-chloe-kim-parents-mn-0850_b4b4685e869a77f84c71eb5bfe3c4629.jpg" medium="image" height="1791" width="2500">
        <media:credit>Mike Blake</media:credit>
        <media:text type="plain">Image: Pyeongchang 2018 Winter Olympics<media:description type="plain">Chloe Kim, back turned, celebrates her gold with her family.</media:description></media:text>
      </media:content>
    </item>
  </channel>
</rss>
